result.execSummary:
The defendant Spenser Allen Weber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Spenser Allen Weber is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Spenser Allen Weber was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Ct#1 15CF61 Pierce County case and to current prison sentence.

10:07 This includes 15CF15 Defendant Spenser Allen Weber in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Defendant Spenser Allen Weber in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Froelich - 15CF61 Plead to Ct 1  12 Months jail.  15CF15  Dism Ct 1, Ct 2 Plead guilty  30 days jail conc to to 15CF61 , Ct 3 Dismiss.   ATty Helgeson agrees.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def  15CF61    Constitutional rights explained to defendant   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct  1.  15CF15    DEF PLEADS GUILTY  Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 2. Court dismisses Ct 1 & 3.    Court orders. 15CF61  Ct 1  12 months jail    15CF15  Ct 2  30 days jail conc to sentence in 15CF61  Both sentences are conc to the prison sentence now serving.
Helgeson pleas not guilty on all counts for Def. Court accepts. Bond to remain in it's current form.

2:11 Defendant Spenser Allen Weber in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary Questionnaire and Waiver form is filed with the Court. Def waives his right to have a preliminary hearing. Court accepts the waiver. Froelich files information; Def and Helgeson have copies of information. Def waives reading of information.
Def voluntarily waives his 20 day time limit for PH
